Update 2/4: They had a cider option & it was delicious!! What a difference to drink cider out of the tap. And I don t have to drive all the way to Burnaby for yummy cider in great vibes. So happy I went back!!

This place was a shocker! I could not believe that have 35 to 40 beers on tap. Its ludicrous! I mean I only get 4 beers on a flight... I cant say much about all the beers, but the ones I have tried I can say that they are unique and some that are really good. The food we ordered was the Fish tacos and the fries (I cannot remember the name, also its off the menu now). The tacos must be one of the best fish tacos I have ever had, and the fries were so good that they went well with all the beers. I love IPAs so I had a double IPA and their annual Filthy Dirty IPA. Both great beers! The second time we came here I had all Barley wines. I was so tipsy after my flight. You can see my picture on how thick the beers were. The one that surprised me the most was the whiskey barrel aged barley wine. Now if youre a whiskey lover and a beer lover, I say this is the beer for you! It absolutely blew my mind how much it had the flavours of whiskey. Great place to come and have great food and great beers! But it gets busy so get there early!

Had a lovely brewery tour today with Corey! We got to go into the back and see where and how it s all made! Three beer samples in the back with more back out in the kitchen! So awesome! I liked my beer so much we had some in house and brought some home!! Awesome staff, so helpful in finding everyone a beer they ll enjoy. Got a burger and fries with our beers. Burger was good, fries were great! Cool that it s made in the food truck in the store. Don t forget to grab a donut of the day! The Nutty Professor is shown here. But you may want to share one as they are HUGE! We couldn t finish ours.

I was working nearby and needed a quick meal. A friend suggested Parallel 49, so we went and grabbed a couple sandwiches   he got the spicy crispy chicken and I got the grilled chicken sandwich. At $18 bucks each, these arent cheap, as that doesnt even include a few fries or other side. But quality doesnt come cheap, and my grilled chicken sandwich was among the best Ive ever had. The chicken breast was big enough to overflow the bun, and it was grilled to juicy and flavourful perfection. The generous slab of brie, fresh arugula, and tangy tarragon aoili made for a meal considerably better than Id expected. Ill absolutely be back.
First time to try brewery for me. This place gave me amazing experience!

This place is great. They have so many varieties of beer at great prices. The atmosphere is really nice and relaxed, not too loud. The food here is fantastic as well. Definitely my favourite place in Vancouver for drinks and food.
The go-to for the most original craft beers. They have so many rotating beers, you ll never get bored. Awesome patio space during Covid. Their Street Kitchen is good too! We love their waffle fries.

Wide selection of house made beer & some cocktails. Small food menu but fine for this type of casual environment. Long bench style seating but if it is not a busy time you can have space. Staff have been pleasant.
The patio is nice with music the beer was great and the grilled Chicken was very tasty!

Renovations, food, new room, looks great!! Really well done, large room lots of seating and natural light, patio outside and over 20 beers on tap, always! Quite the variety to choose from, food truck inside. Nice work!! Must try brewery with great hours and happy/ friendly staff. Very nicely done!
Wonderful place to spend ur evening, with good beer and delicious food and lovely staff
Good beer with a fried chicken sandwich. A good place to hang out. I just hope they could change their chairs. A little bit uncomfortable

Came for a little lunch and left full with a slight buzz. Huge selection of beers and other drinks. I had the blue cheese and bacon burger with fries. Fantastic food. I would highly recommend checking out Parallel 49!
Great craft brewery experience! A very healthy amount and style of beer to choose from. Really enjoyed the style!

A bit out of the way, but lots of seating and really cool decor and menu board! Tons of beer selections. I had the fish tacos and fries, really delicious! The person that was taking our orde made me feel rushed and her tone didnt sound friendly when I asked about food options. She was wearing glasses and had long hair, that wasnt tied back. Since later, she was pouring the beer, should be tie back!

Always a great time when I come here with friends, the beer selection is out of this world. But the absolute cherry on top is the fact that they sell a spicy chicken sandwich that has got to be so delicious that I wish it was larger.  The waffle fries are also a really great addition.  Excited to come back here again in the future.

My favourite place for beer and fries with chicken wings. This time I ordered chicken burger which is the best in town but the fries      if I was living close by you would see me every night there!! Thank you for making such a crunch fried for us!

Great place to grab a beer! Definitely an Uber ride if you are staying downtown or close to it but well worth it. Snacks were great and the beer selection was so good you could try a new one each time you went up

The place was a little bit crowded but every table was divided to be safe as soon as you walk in sanitizer available and all servers and cooks they were wearing mask fast service i had a pleasant time with my family

Great beer, tons of good selections. The food here is delicious definately good pairings with the beer. The staff are extremely friendly and welcoming. They will help answer any questions you have. We did the brewery tour. Sam was an exceptional tour guild. He explained the process very clearly and was very helpful in answering all the questions we have. The tour is really worth it. We will always come back for food and beer for sure.

Choices, choices, choices.  This is what your problem will be.  Huge assortment of beer, friendly cheerful staff, tasty food menu, ample parking by the street (but, dont drink and drive fellas - get a designated driver to tag along!)  Even the DD will enjoy this place for sure.
First brewery experience in Canada. Was mind blown by the variety of beers and food that were available. A fantasy experience. Must try the French Pilsner.

Came for Oktoberfest. Really well set up. The band was super fun. Lines were a little long so order 2 at a time. Then switched over to the normal side where it was a bit quieter. My beer server was named Josh and he went above and beyond to take my order and pour my drinks when staff was short even tho he was working the other side. Saved the day. Thanks Josh for helping a thirsty gal out! Also they were definitely checking vax passports and IDs. Went on a weekday.

So many beers on tap to choose from! Decent food menu to curb the hunger pains. Weve been drinking Parallel 49 since before the brewery scene exploded at home (Calgary) and were honored to visit. Only criticism is they had NO MERCH! Not even a sticker  . Parallel 49, if you want made in Canada socks, hit us up - Plainsbreaker Apparel    .

Went there for a work function and was pleasantly surprised by the food and beer. Good quality. Better than I expected, by far. Only issue is the lineup at the bar, especially when there is one cashier and she is trying to put out flights of beers, which people are choosing at their leisure. Also: No table service. (You get up and get what you need for yourself.) Still. A place like this? Within walking distance to my home? BLESS YOU, UNIVERSE.

Always have lots of great beers.  The street kitchen food truck is a great way to have a kitchen setup. Food is amazing. Less friendly way of setting up a brewery kind of just a production line service order, pay, move on no real interaction with the staff poring your beers. Bit overall a good spot to stop for beers and food
A must try brewery. Great selection of beers for all (even) NAs and good food menu.

Had a great time in the outdoor patio space during Oktoberfest! The pumpkin beer is sooo good and perfect for the occasion. It was fun to see people dressed up in lederhosen and singing along to the absolutely adorable live band. I got the curry bratwurst with fries. Very yummms :) recommend people go go early next year because the line started to get quite long.
Great pub style food, amazing beer selection, and some cocktails. Theyve got an extended patio for summer 2020... Maybe longer. Love this place.

Favourite brewery in the lower mainland. Tons of beer choices and everything I tried was great. Food is expensive for a brewery but also AMAZING for a brewery. I think the food might ve been better than the beer.. Best French fries, super good smash burger, and the chicken fingers were bomb

Burgers were epic! Theres a ton of amazing beers to try as well as sweet drinks. My wife loved the fruit punch vodka muddler. Staff were all super chill as was the vibe of the whole place. Well definitely be back!

Been coming here for a few years but this week is awesome - Biergarten season, complete with Oompa band (with one of the best Tuba players I ve heard, doing solos you won t believe). The Midnight Train beer - Rum aged is to die for. Cheers! or Prosit! as they say. Update: Nov 2021- patio and beer garden gone for the season. Unfortunately so is all the dark delicious beer, like porters and stouts. Dozens of beers on tap and yet absolutely nothing on but light, American-style IPA and fruity beers. Seems the fate of so many Vancouver brewers to go the lazy route and resort to cheap and easy to produce kid -friendly (young inexperienced drinkers) beers. Here s hoping for the return of deep delicious beers soon. Check before you go or you may be disappointed.
Great spot with lots of options. Some good eats too.

Loved the vibe this place has to offer, even with safe distancing protocols. There s patio and inside seating available. Very impressive sanitizing procedures were in order. The screens between the tables were seen sanitized after every group left. Try the waffle fries, you won t regret it! The dressing was great. We also tried dry ribs In sweet and hot flavour. They were so good. Lots of IPA varieties to choose from. Place can be busy over the weekends. Great value for the food and drinks. Will be back for sure.

Great atmosphere with a fantastic staff who is friendly and helpful. We had great recommendations from the counter staff who made sure our flight was exactly what we were expecting. Donut & pretzel was great too! With a food truck inside it, theres nothing quite like Parallel 49!
Great beer list, helpful staff, and the food was pretty good as well.
Awesome beers, great food, this is how its done. Big ups from Perth Australia!
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Our team is so pleased that you were satisfied with your experience, thank you for taking the time to leave a positive review. We will make sure to share it with the rest of the team!

detailed_reviews.review_text: People bagging on this space because it got a facelift, got food and more selection, youre idiots then brew your own beer at home and make dinner yourself. This place is dope. I prefer it post reno by far. Great selection and food was tasty. Only prob was most of veg options were off menu by afternoon as they had sold out.

Easily the best brewery in East Van. A little off the path of the core breweries in and around Clark but well worth the short detour for their Massive menu of beers. Foods pretty decent, bar type food but enough choice even for a vegetarian like myself. And who doesn t love a food truck right in the brewery itself?

So many beers! I just dont like that it is always busy in the evening, so I have to sit super close to a stranger beside me. Its very very close. We could hear all their conversation clearly. They listened to ours too.
Im sitting in Kelowna having a Parallel 49 beer....delicious. I will now seek out a place that sells this. I love it

Customer service and quality exceeds all expectations at Parallel 49. Been coming here for years and you are always greeted promptly. I cant forget to mention but they have the best beer in Vancouver. If youre debating on going to try it out. DO IT!!!

Like craft beer? This west coast institution is a must visit! Their most recent edition of a food truck in the tasting room provides classic pub/street food in the form of tacos, burgers ect. The beer selection is huge so come thirsty!

Always love this place. And its even better since theyve made updates to the tasting room. Cool atmosphere, great beer, tasty food. Parking can be tricky if its busy and the area is a bit sketchy but... Do recommend!

I like their beers and their food! All kind of beers I tasted were palatable! I liked the wheatwine, even it was a bit stronger than the others. For to eat I had an incredible delicious spicy vegetarian taco with jackfruit and pineapple. This was undoubtedly the best taco I ever had in my whole life!
Salt and Pepper wings and Spicy chicken burger taste so good    (forgot to that picture of the burger). And they have really good beer

Huge selection! Midnight train is unreal! Their milkshake ipa is good as well. Honestly, all their beer is good and very reasonably priced to go. Seems like a good work culture, too as the staff there seem very happy!
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: This means a lot to all our staff and management, thank you for your positive feedback!

detailed_reviews.review_text: It s a little bit of a journey to get there but it s worth it. One of the more unique breweries I ve been too with a large selection of tasty beers, good eats, and awesome friendly staff. They also have a daily donut which is hard to argue with.
Nothing but great options - I normally get a flight at a brewery to decide which beer I want a full glass of; that choice was harder than it s ever been here.
Love it!  You always know youre going to get street food... The truck is in the house!  Literally!  The liquids are pretty good too!    Super friendly staff!  Cheers!  What a great stop!
Lovely beers and atmosphere! Our first night in Canada was very well spent here!
Easy parking, so much fun, huge variety of beer, nice music
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for the kind words, Alejandra!

detailed_reviews.review_text: Great selection of drinks, the food is alright. We liked the place overall.

The best! Updates review! Keep coming keep getting better, service is good, great selections of beers, awesome food [they don t sell the Cuban sandwich anymore    ] special promotions and great atmosphere.
We stopped in for some beer and the staff was so helpful with directions and recommendations for other breweries in the area
The best place for a craftbeer! They have a lot of beers and all are great. The food is awesome and the price is really good.

I love this place; finally got to check out their tap room and the food was a very welcome bonus. The twicks and paradise better become Parallel alumni because they are incredible!! I always wanted to check out the small batches that dont make their way outside of BC and Im so glad I had the chance to check out my favorite brewery in person when I did. Fingers crossed on those two beers becoming regular shipping-ready brews because they are absolutely fantastic, and frankly, P49 dont seem to export too many darker brews/stouts, so it would be awesome to see those two as their showcase set. I cannot say enough good things about those two, if theyre in rotation you must try them! Regretfully, the casino royale ran out before I could try it.

Had a great experience at the patio today with my boyfriend having beers and burgers. I had the impossible burger and he had the beef one with waffle fries, they both were delicious! (No pictures because we ate them so fast) The staff is gorgeous and very nice and friendly. Thank you for an amazing dinner, well come back to try wings :)
Great place to try some new beers. Had some waffle fries and they were great too! I will come again with more of my friends. Music was great too
Parallel is located in E Van Wharehouse area and it was a great time out. Had the Trash Panda and Jerk Face beer lol. Highly recommend you go their for beer and snacks.
Oh, wonderful, we celebrated with our friends for one of our friends birthday

Not only does Parallel 49 have some of my fave canned beers available almost anywhere, but a visit to the brewery is always something above expectations. They have a huge selection on beer on tap and food available from an on-site food truck. There is always something new to try. Definelty one of our favorite spots. Kid friendly, dog friendly. Clean bathrooms and helpful staff. Excellent every time
Excellent food and drinks options, excellent environment and great service !
The food here is amazing, you cant go wrong with anything off the menu... But the Korean ribs are a game changer!!! Enjoying deliciousness in the sun!
Havent been here however have been a consumer of the beers. Simply the best IPAs around as far as I can tell. Cobra clutch- gorgeous Theres a smoothness I cannot identify or find anywhere else. Yumm!
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you Jan! We are thrilled to hear the positive feedback.

detailed_reviews.review_text: Decent food, huge variety of beers, friendly service.

The beer selection here is insane. We were able to get two flights and not have a single overlapping beer...and we still had more to choose from! We also got the loaded fries special which was a nacho style....and it was crazy good! Will be coming back again for food and drinks!
Great selection of amazing beers Food selection is going well with the drinks.
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for the kind words, Sebastien! This is great to hear.

detailed_reviews.review_text: Best veggie burger ever. The beer was pleasant too.

I ve been drinking ( & making ) a lot of beer for over 65 years and you folks have got it  right  with your P46 pale ale. Instead of clobbering the beer drinker with far too much IBU (big problem with many  local  types reflect on European ales!), you have achieved an excellent balance of hoppy taste & well rounded malty flavor. Nice effort, guys!
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Amazing to hear, Gordon! We greatly appreciate the positive feedback. Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review.

detailed_reviews.review_text: Beer choices, flavors are tremendous. Food service was mixed. Quality of food very good but mixed up the orders for a table of four. Food service seemed overwhelmed by Noon on a Tuesday. Special fries also were sold out by noon. Who knows what it would be like on a holiday weekend..

I am very grateful for this new opening in Lower Lonsdale. After 3 locations in metro Vancouver it was time for Parallel 49 to open a branch in North Shore. They should consider opening another shop in West Vancouver but its up to them! I tried their famous Caffe Americano with Tiramisu Bismarck and honestly I couldnt find a better way to begin my day! The barista lady was very friendly and easy to talk. I also love their store setup from wooden antique looking shelves and displays to awesome furniture and decor and of course a working AC in these hot summer days!
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: We are grateful for your kind words. Thanks for sharing your feedback with us and the community!

detailed_reviews.review_text: Tons of beers on tap and helpful staff to help you choose! Lots of IPAs if youre into hoppy beer. Excellent atmosphere and the food looked great too but we didnt try any... Until next time!

Had a great time here! Amazing selection of beers and the food was great! Very covid friendly with the HUGE outdoor patio. We had to wait a bit to be seated, but was expected considering it was a Friday evening. Still recommended!

Great experience at Parallel 49 Brewing. One of Vancouvers earlier breweries, their latest renovation works well. In addition to their own brews, they serve about 40 taps of local brews and a decent selection of food. The place is popular with the locals who bike or walk here, giving the place a friendly, laid back vibe. Years later, post-coviid, food is even better and beer is still great.

My father and I were in town from Saskatchewan and were wanting to try some craft beers. Well worth the trip down to West Van. 37 beers on tap the day we were there. Only 3 of them were out of stock due to an event that happened the day before. My dad had a pretzel and told me it was excellent with their mustard pairing. We had great service, very friendly personable staff. Phenomenal guest Taps. Their own brews were really good. I particularly liked Old Boy brown ale and Ugly Sweater Milk stout. I definitely recommend stopping by since their beer roster is always changing. Something for everyone.
Amazing beer selection, and the food is pretty darn good too. Check it out, you wont be disappointed.

My wife and I first tried Ruby Tears Northwest Red Ale last March and we both loved it.  Then Covid happened and we started getting our groceries AND our beer delivered.  Parallel 49 not only produces our favourite beer; but they provide a great service by delivering it right to our door.  The delivery staff and everyone we have talked to on the phone have been very friendly too.  Great beer....great employees.....great company!
Good selection of beers, nicestaff, great ambiance.

The beer selection here is immense and the food is good. This is, to my knowledge, the largest tasting room in Vancouver. I ve found it easy to pick highly enjoyable beers here. When I go to fill growlers, I usually find myself here. When I take people to see what Vancouver has to offer for craft beer, this is usually my first stop.

I really enjoy the food. The menu (which is smallish) has had items switched up a few times keeping things fresh. They also do a daily doughnut, which are delicious and always a surprise. The beer menu almost has to many to choose from....almost. Add in some really awesome street art, and friendly staff, its always an enjoyable visit.

Have driven by several times and had never stopped in.  Traffic one day was bad, so thought I would stop in for a beer and bite to eat (dont worry, only one beer - I was driving).  Glad I did.  The beer selection was a bit of everything that you could want (I will have to go back sans car to try more)... but what has won the 5 stars from me was the food truck food... by far one of the best burgers I have ever had!!!

name: 33 Acres Brewing Company
description: House-brewed craft beer & cafe fare offered in a cool, minimalist space with rustic accents.
address: 33 Acres Brewing Company, 15 W 8th Ave, Vancouver, BC V5Y 1M8

detailed_reviews.review_text: You can t go wrong with 33. Seriously though. I recently had the pleasure of stopping in at 33 Acres Brewing after nearly a year. And I must say this place never disappoints. It was an amazing experience. The beer was incredibly delicious (as always) and the atmosphere (good music too) was super friendly and inviting. The staff at 33 are always extremely helpful and knowledgeable, always going out of their way to make sure I enjoy my time and have a good time. I would highly recommend stopping in for a pint or two if youre ever near the area as its a really great establishment. The outdoor seating is also awesome and a great way to enjoy a sunny day. Cheers!

Fantastic local brewery. Great beers, good range and all done pretty well. My favourites are the French blanche and schwarzbier but everything Ive tried has been above average. Great selection of snacks and excellent vibes.

Great beers and great outdoor patio on a quiet, tree-lined street. I would say this is the brewery with the best ambience in Mt Pleasant. WARNING: They do NOT do growler fills. If you google 33 acres growler fills the first result will tell you that they are doing growler fills, but it is not true (as of August 2023). On the FAQ of their website, they mention that they are currently not doing growler fills. Hopefully they consider doing them again - literally every other brewery in the area does.
Beautiful taproom and lovely beer. Ample seating and clear space.

Really enjoy coming here with friends. The beer menu is great (recommendation: my favourite so far is 33 Acres of Sunshine) and we love the neighbourhood vibe. Plus, for after-work gatherings, the easy snack selection makes for a good tie-over to dinner plans afterwards.

Often my first stop when traveling to Vancouver. 33Acres IPA s are a craft beer favorite and brewery snacks and food is delicious. Highly recommend their weekend brunch options. Friendly staff makes for an all around pleasant experience.

Nice brewery with a variety of beers to try out. One side has they regular beers and the other side has all their seasonal beers. They also have a patio section as well now which is new. Not much for food so it s more of a place to try different beers and not for dinner. Worth coming to for the variety of beers and atmosphere.

Went on a Sunday afternoon, lucky enough to get a table right away, cause this place is usually super busy. Tried the Tomato Avocado Benedict on waffles, it looks like a simple dish, but it tastes so good! Even the side salad is awesome! Also tired the German Pretzel, a bit on the hard side, so I wouldnt recommend it. And of course, the most important thing at this place, the beer! Love it!

As we waded through the sea of pretentious fake-fancy granola munchers who only recycle so that they can tell their endless string of two-month-long tinder girlfriends that they care about the environment as much as they care about leeching off of their west-van trust funds so that they can fill the gap that their lackluster careers leave behind, I realized it: this place is pretty great. The ambiatic tone and timber lets me know that Im in a safe place where I can sauce it up on tasty local beers, the aesthetic warms my cold heart and truly pleases my Instagram followers. Try as many beers as you can. Theyre all great. You seriously cant go wrong. Take some home. Bring your folks. Bring your friends. Bring a date. Nestle in and grab yourself a spicy sausage stick, do yourself the favour, you deserve it. Five stars.
Great beers and vibes!! The best beer we had in Vancouver   staff were really friendly and everything was clean and tidy. Being English we loved that it was order at the bar

The 33 Acres of sunshine used to be my favourite beer because its easy drinking and the 24 oz is bound to mess you up. The room is loud, there is no outdoor seating so expect to stand around if you come during the weekend. You could also buy a six pack or a growler and sit at the near by park. Their food is alright, the chacuterie doesnt come with cheese and the chicken burger was ok.
Cute place, great patio, good beer and drinks, my gin and tonics where perfect. Excellent customer service, I order some bites, no 100% sure is the place for dinner, but for drinks perfect,

West coast brewery tour continues .today s adventure takes us to 33 Acres to sit out on the patio. Top 3 tried were the 33 Acres of Darkness (Dark Lager) , 33 Acres of MKII (Mezcal Gose) and 33 Acres of MK I (Dryhopped Pilsner). Cheapest TO GO beers as well

A bit of a misnomer, there were no 33 year old bio-clock-is-ticking types for me to saddle up beside. Oh well, at least the beer is delicious and the concept is executed perfectly I guess. Turns out if you put your mind to it, hipsters will drink up your concept if you sell reigning champ swag. Make sure you wash the heavy terry crew neck at least 3 times like I washed my mouth after a swig of that belgian quad. 11.3%, yikes!
Nice atmosphere with tasty beers

My favorite brewery. Is a great place , super friendly staff , impecible interior and brand  design, amazing beer , a Slayer coffee machine and a pizza truck. Seriously great place to visit. The merchandise is on point as well. Love it.

One of my favourite Beer & Food stops. Have the Loaded breakfast sandwich on a homemade biscuit wowowowow. Today I was a little late for the breakfast so I had the Thai salad. The food didn t disappoint. Washed it all down with a little 33Acres of sunshine.

Beer is AMAZING! Mezcal gose was a very interesting surprise, might ve been my favourite. Not normally a fan of sours but really enjoyed it.  Friendly efficient service, liked it all. Highly recommend if in town
Great brunch place to go to on the weekends. I loved their avocado tomato Benny and cortado. Great place for a cup of coffee. Their beers are also on point!
Taco Thursdays are perfect! The music is right on point! It is nice to have some live music in the brewery
Very cool... very instagramy ... you have to try the Sunshine if you are a big fan of Belgian beer... annnnnd... make sure you head to the next door after this... more surprise coming!

One of the original (newer) craft breweries in the city and still one of the best. Clean lines, long tables, and a simple decor all help you focus on what youre there for -- the beer. They have fantastic items for brunch like the avocado toast or freshly-baked bread, and in the around lunch during they always have a food truck out front to satisfy any food cravings. Definitely a place to check out.

Great beer in a very personal setting. I love the self serve water taps, actually! Having sparkling and still water is amazing and truly appreciated! They also serve some light snacks & coffee, including Cartems Donuts, Ernest Ice Cream, almonds/nuts, and pretzels! It gets really busy here, especially on a nice day, but the service is always quick as its all done at the bar. Really great testing beers, I highly recommend this place!

We got two samplers, and they were huge! I liked all of them, but loved 3/4 of them. Even styles I dont usually drink. They have a nice outdoor seating area for when you want to enjoy the sun or bring your pooch.

I love this place. Between the delicious craft beer, the tasty small (and not-so-small) plates of food and the cozy but vibrant atmosphere, it makes me want to visit often. Beer is served up in 10.5oz and 24oz pours. Also fill up your growler or pick up bottles from the fridge. Kids are also welcome in the tasting room.

Great brewery and casual date spot for beers in Vancouver. Also have a great menu for light food! They are a super popular spot, so prepare to wait when visiting in the summer on a weekend. Usually a 30m wait typical weekend afternoon on warmer days.

One of my favourites. Good coffee, good beer, nice staff and super bright, minimalist aesthetic. Always my top suggestion for when friends/family wanna catch up when I m in town. Love my canvas tote bag too  I m on my 2nd one but now it s super worn out. Gonna have my mum bring me another one when she comes to visit me in Morocco!

Friendly staff who offered a taste test and a number of recommendations, a nice selection of good beer, and a number of good non-beer options including tea and snacks! The tea was a high-quality loose leaf - its nice that they put effort into the non-alcoholic options too. The place was very crowded, but the space is well used and the atmosphere is friendly.
Amazing beers. Great prices, fantastic energy, great set up. If you re ever in town this is the best place to go.
I love this place! The beers are really good, and they have lots of space on their patio. The staff is very friendly!

Perfect after lunch stop! Beer was great and had a range to fit all tastes from stouts to IPAs, even cider!. Staff very welcoming. Big bright windows, airy open space with industrial communal table, white walls & succulents everywhere-- an instagrammers delight!!
A beautiful and relaxing space with top notch beers. A favourite place to meet friends during the day or grab some beers to go and watch the sunset at Jonathan Rogers park
Great local brewery with unique beers and surprisingly good food. The actual space is very small and often busy so you may have trouble finding seating for a larger group.

This is a must go to place. Everything at 33 acres is done with purpose. From the way the beer packaging lines up when flipped either way, to the perfect branding on their coffee cups, to the clothing that they have made in Vancouver it s all done well to make a clean and awesome package. That image then meshes well with the products they offer which is crafted with the same purpose. The beer is great, the food is top notch for breweries, and the coffee is good (my preference would be for a little bit stronger of an espresso). Go here, be patient, and enjoy one of the most happening places in Vancouver.
Absolutely delicious. The 33 Ocean is immensely drinkable, and the Belgian Tripel took me back to my time in Leuven. Edit: music is about 10db too loud
Skilled in a range of beers. The fluffy clouds IPA was my favorite (Citra & El dorado). Great take out selection and prices. Very cool surf atmosphere and space
The cutest brewery ever! The beer was yummy. The only down side is it is very busy and hard to find a seat sometimes!
Really nothing to say about them: creative, delicious, cool ambience. Food could be better, but we not here for this really ;)
Clean brews! Brunch was amazing and small catch B33R was awesome.  Cafeteria red was my favorite
Top quality beers, coffee, and food in a really fun atmosphere. This places does it all so well. Loved my visit.
I love this place. Deco, people are awesome the beer is D-Beer! Just amazing!
Great beer, great location and a sexy minimal setting make 33 Acres a must for a drink at dusk. Great date place! ;)

A really delicious $8 can of beer! At these prices, you can buy exactly 250 cans of beer with $2000 CERB money. If the $8 is too much, you can ask to keep the cans, and return them for $0.05 a piece. So if you drink 250 cans, you can get back $125. FYI - Im only here because R&B opens at 2pm, they got $8 pints. Actual pints of fresh beer served in an actual glass for $8, sometimes $7.
Tasty apple cider, and great esthetics to the space. Go for a beer on the patio.

Update: I spoke with one of the managers and he was so nice and made me feel so much better. Thank you for your empathy and generosity! It made my day. On our last visit, one of the staff members made our group extremely uncomfortable. Hostile for no reason. We were so uneasy that we were hesitant to get up even to use their washrooms. As a local, it will be difficult to forget this experience. Beer is 5 stars.
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Viorica, we are very sorry to hear about your experience, this is not how we want someone to leave our brewery feeling. Can you please send us an email so we can reach out to you over the phone. We d love to find out more information so we can learn how to be better. Thank you! Josh

detailed_reviews.review_text: Great beers and staff. Love the experimental side of things. Will go back one day when I m back in the city
Here is my favorite place in Vancouver. s So awooooooosome!! Beer is perfect!!! And pizza is the best. I love here:)
33 Acres Of Ocean beer is delicious!  Get the 24oz!
Perfect place for those who likes experiments! Cosy and warm, nice ambience and silent to work and have a decent conversation.

my favorite in b.c.. experimental beers are so tasty. love the cloudy ipa with the blue dots.. the dark and euphoria are excellent! definitely recommend trying. never been to the actual brewery but the neg reviews sound like standard vancouver shenanigans
Good beer

I really enjoy 33 acres beer, the service is always very engaging.. On our last visit,  we got to sit downstairs , its a nice space with great natural light. One of mine and Hubbys favourite beers there is the Mezcal Gose. Go check it out
Amazing assortment of canned beers and on tap options.

One of my all-time favourite breweries in the city! They always have a great beer selection and tasty snacks to go with it. They just opened their new patio and its perfect (especially when you want to maintain a safe distance from other people). I definitely recommend any of their sours as they never disappoint!

Right next door to their Experimental Brewery, this place follows the same pattern in offering a great atmosphere and friendly staff. After experiencing their experimental brews next door, coming over and having one of their pizzas was a delicious follow up that hit the spot just perfectly. It is no wonder this brewery has so many accolades and awards from the beer community! Highly recommend this place and would suggest you try any (and if possible, ALL their pizzas). 10/10, would recommend.
One of my favourite breweries. Love the fluffy cloud hazy ipa also their new covid patio is great
One of the best brewers in the city. The brewery is a great place to sit for a while and they have a great food menu as well as a food truck parked close by
This quality of drink and food from this craft brewery is near to the gods. A must.

Fluffy Cloud IPA forever!! Love their glasses that are the size of my head. Probably my favourite brewery in Vancouver, love coming here and would recommend for its beautiful minimalist atmosphere vibe, cute wooden patio, friendly staff, as well as being in a fun part of the neighbourhood to walk around, surrounded by murals and trees.
Well we found ET, an angry bird as well as two fish swimming beside each other.    Excellent night
Love this brewery. Often busy but ver cute vibes and 33 Acres of Sunshine is my JAM.
First time here and love it. Helpful server with recommendations for great beer. A Kolsch IPA? Oh soooo good.

We hit up 33acres experimental. This place has a cool vibe. We got 2 flights so we could try a variety of beers. They have some pretty interesting flavors and they are super good as expected. Growler fills and cans available too. We have been regulars at the original 33acres since they opened. So glad they are expanding and trying new things! Keep up the good work.

Their beer is simple, clean, and crisp. It seems like they aim to make the cleanest version of any given style and they do it well. While I enjoy and appreciate this, I generally enjoy the Experimental side more as their beer is generally more complex or interesting. When I take people to tasting rooms, this one is in my top 3. The only disappointment I ve had here is trying to get growler fills. Whatever they have on tap, my favourite never seems to be available for growler fills.
Great atmosphere. I love coming here with friends for brunch.

I really enjoy the atmosphere and decor of this particular brewery. They serve brunch on the weekend and have a handful of really reasonable options. Otherwise, they also have an assortment of food options including jerky, pizza and ice cream! They also serve coffee and tea as well, so great for a group that may have non-beer drinkings. It can get quite busy in the afternoon of a weekend and they monitor the capacity quite a bit, so just be aware of this!
Great sour in the 33 Acres of Mescal.  Very vibrant micro brewery.

Great time at 33 Acres. The beer was cheaper than anywhere else we went in that area which was awesome. We got the popcorn (soooo good) and the nuts. The nuts could have been a bit more flavorful and crunchy but overall we were impressed.

Didnt particularly enjoy my beer but that doesnt mean that this place isnt great. The dude that helped us pick was fantastic. The patio is great and the place is cool. If youre looking for a good brewery Id recommend stopping here

Very hip place with a cozy atmosphere. Beers are very tasty and offer is broad. They serves few dishes that go well with a beer (cheese plate is very tasty). Downside is, that this place can get very loud easily. If you love beer and smaller places with good vibes, this is place for you.

Continues to be one of the best local breweries with consistently excellent standard products - 33 Acres of Sunshine or California Commons anyone!  Interesting seasonal or rotating taps - we really enjoyed the Mezcal Lime Gose on a really hot afternoon!  Big, shady outdoor patio just off the hustle and noise of Main and Broadway.  Quiet leafy oasis for a refreshing beverage :-)

Great beer served up by a wonderful staff who really loves their products. The beer alone is great, but they serve up a mean pizza and wicked brunch on the weekends. Come thirsty and hungry! We always make a point to stop by as were from out of town.

Finally got in here for brunch and it blew my mind!! So good! Not at all what you would expect from a brewery... highly recommend for evening beers but also as amazing for brunch on the weekends. It does get busy as it s a small place so try to go early or prepare for a wait.

Coolest brewery in the lower mainland. Great food, solid beer options. Typically super busy but if you can get a table this is definitely an amazing spot for good times. Also serves coffee until 5pm and has other non-alcoholic beverage options. Food menu typically changes from time to time.

Get the 33 acres of Sunshine while you are here. Light refreshing crisp beer for a mildly sunny afternoon, whats more to ask for. Trendy student crowd when I visited here, wish the establishment was a much bigger size with a beer garden as that would have definitely made the experience much better. Just so you know, their beer is available at several other places too, including the Craft Beer Market.
Enjoyed the beers and the atmosphere. Will definitely be back on my next visit to Vancouver

Cute place to grab a drink with a date. They have lots of outdoor seating (picnic table style) and larger tables inside for groups. Simple and clean decor with a good bit of plants. We tried the Baby Azacca, MEZCAL GOSE and a fruity sour I think was called poppy(?) which were all great. I liked the 24oz glasses so much I had to buy two, I can t wait to use the wide glasses at home and enjoy some 33 acres bevvies.

Being from San Diego, Id like to think that I know a good IPA when I see one, and both their Nirvana (IPA) and Roam (double IPA) were fantastic, even better than many San Diego beers that Ive had. In addition, the atmosphere was very hip, they sold growlers of pretty much all of their beers, and six packs of a handful of others. The pizza that we got from the food truck that is regularly sitting outside was also very good. I ended up grabbing a growler of the Roam to take back to San Diego with me, as well as a bomber of one of their specialty aged beers.
Great beer, cool atmosphere, and awesome weekend brunch / coffee
Great little brewery, small and quaint. Very modern layout and the beer is just amazing. Top quality beer! Can t go working with the 33 acres of Sunshine. An absolute staple in Vancouver

Really enjoyed the beer and vibe here. Food truck churning out awesome smelling stone baked pizzas outside was a great touch. Small capacity, but didnt have to wait too long to get in on a warm friday evening.

The vibe of the place is even better than the beers they sell - and that s not to downplay the beers... they re great! They also have a delicious cider and occasionally have non-alcoholic kombucha available for people who aren t so into booze. They offer a few small snacks but also often have a food truck parked outside and allow you to bring in theirs goodies. Plus they have a dog tie up outside and lots of windows so you can sip on your brew and peep on your dog at the same time.
On my last visits. This place is so cool. Carter was so knowledgeable. Shaq Heather were unbelievable. Great job on service and beer. Mental is a hit.

I love this spot - always fun to try a new beer or get your fav. Brunch is amazing, super fresh and high quality. Really appreciate their outdoor seating during COVID. My one wish is that they did a meat AND cheese charcuterie board. They only have a cheese OR a meat board haha.

Favourite brewery in the city, wide array of delicious craft choices paired with a nice selection of snacks. The tasting room is on the smaller side, expect to wait a few minutes during peak hours. I can assure you its worth the wait.

My favourite brewery in the city! Beautiful decor and fantastic selection of b33r. They have two stores side by side, the one that offers their original flavors and the other with seasonal flavors. I really like their orginals but that one tends to be busier.
Fantastic brewery! Many kind of unique hint flavor mixed with bold tasty beers. Best IPA in Vancouver!! I cant tell you a word more than tasty!! They also have pizza menu what I love!!

Super cool brewery with limited seating.  We showed up on a Friday night so Im not sure if there is a wait all the time, but there was our entire time here.  The brews were very good and the food was great as well.  There was also a food truck (mexican) when we arrived but it was gone pretty soon after that, around 7 or 8pm. Staff was great and friendly and ordering was no problem.  Loved this place!

33 Acres has some super tasty beers. Ive enjoyed pretty much everything Ive had here. They also serve some food like a cheese board or pretzels and mustard. Its not like you can get a full meal here, but its something so youre not just drinking on an empty stomach. Also theres usually a food truck outside if you do get really hungry. The decor inside very clean and white.

The beer is top notch, and the food is complimentary to the beer experience. Regardless of the types of beer that you like, theres something for you here. They also have delicious ciders that vary in dryness. Overall, 33 Acres is a must visit if youre in the neighbourhood (actually, if youre not in the neighbourhood, go get in the neighbourhood, and drink some delicious beer).

This has been my #1 favourite local brewery ever since I knew about 33 Acres in 2014.  Love their beer selection, coffee and food, served by wonderful, friendly staff.  The place gets really busy starting at noon and you can tell how popular this place is!
Great beer, fantastic atmosphere and good selection of yummy eats.
Delicious beer, their Euphoria IPA is a total Knockout! Friendly staff and a chill vibe!  10/10 would visit again.
I always liked 33 Acres, but the Fluffy Cloud IPA changed the Vancouver beer scene for me. The staff remained awesome through the mandatory restrictions, and so did the general vibe.

Great little microbrewery with some fantastic beers. The Acres of Life California common is very smooth, should be a crowd pleaser. The Acres of Darkness was my favourite, its deliciously malty with a bit of coffee and toffee taste. Love it! Wish we had breweries like this in Alberta.
Great beers in a hipsterish atmosphere. Loved id
Amazing beers and atmosphere. Food is great paired with their beers as well.
Great food and fast service.  Instant fan of the ginger beer!
By far my favourite brewery in mount pleasant. The experimental location next door always has something great on tap. We definitely recommend to any beer lovers.

Cozy hang out location for beer, coffee, pizza and snacks.  The staff are very friendly and offered free samples as I was in to get a growler filled.  Seating area was filled with people working on laptops or grabbing a bite to eat, coffee shop style.  They also sell apparel, growler containers and bottles of their own beer.

name: Red Truck Beer Company
address: Red Truck Beer Company, 295 E 1st Ave, Vancouver, BC V5T 1A7

detailed_reviews.review_text: Great beer and really good food too! My favorite place to have a burger and a beer. I love everything on the menu from their wings to sandwiches and even eggs. I just wonder why they don t have a club sandwich. They have a great grilled chicken burger and a mean BLT but no club sandwich. I would love to see a club sandwich on the menu!
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for the great review Cathalino!

detailed_reviews.review_text: This place hit the spot.  The fish burger was huge! and delicious  the flight was 4x6ox for $9, great deal! But above all, the vibes were great. This place reminds me of my dad who was a trucker. They had live music with Dino, who was excellent. The sunset was hitting our table just right which gave it a memorable evening. The red truck out front was a nice photo-op.

I recently visited Red Truck Restaurant in Vancouver and had a great time. I would highly recommend Red Truck Restaurant for their delicious salad, generous portion sizes, impressive beer selection, and great live music. If youre looking for a fun and tasty dining experience in Vancouver, this is definitely a spot to check out!

This is one of the best breweries i have ever been to and i am a brewery connoisseur. The views of the massive tanks through the windows are a marvel to look at. The service is incredible, the staff always gives the best customer service experience. They have a fantastic selection of beer as well. Perfect place for an anniversary drink
Awesome food, great beer (can t beat their original lager) and service. One of my favourite breweries in BC!
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Hark, we appreciate your review and are happy to hear we are one of your favourite breweries! Hope to have you back again.

detailed_reviews.review_text: The ambience was nice.  The fish and chips had a really nice flaky crust and the bbq hotdog had well flavored brisket that was not fatty.  The beer was solid but we were hoping for at least one darker beer.
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for the great feedback Carol!

detailed_reviews.review_text: Great place for a bite and bev. Their food and drink menu is decent. Patio space is adequate and so is parking. Wings special on Wednesday ($3 off), beef brisket sando was delicious. Would def be back.

Great meeting place as I come from the North Shore & meet friends downtown. Always easy, free and safe parking for their bikes & my car. And now some of us bring our dogs too - which prompted me to write this joyous review! The live music starts early enough that we can soak that in as well.

My first time dining at Red Truck Beer with my hubby and brothers after work.  Recommended by hubby who goes there with his co-workers.  We were meeting my hubby at Red Truck Beer.  My brother drove me and when we rolled into the parking lot I didnt expect its where craft beer is brewed.  My hubby did the ordering as he was there first with garlic fries and wings. You need to order at the counter and pay first.  Youll get a number to take to your table which helps the server to bring your order to the correct table. I had the Fish Sandwich which had beer battered cod, lettuce, tomatoe and siriracha mayo with side salad (gotta had something healthy right?) :). It was a large sandwich and flavourful.  With the crunch from the beer battered cod and freshness from vegetables this was a great start to a weekend. My brothers ordered Smoke Brisket Sandwich and Sante Fe Eggs so I cant really comment other than they enjoyed their meal. Great times at Red Truck Beer!  I cant have alcohol but still had a great time at Red Truck Beer!
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for coming by and taking the time to let us know about your visit. We hope to see you again soon!!

detailed_reviews.review_text: Best place for a beer had my 68 year old birthday and got so drunk I broke my walker on my way out. Big Betty my neighbour had her first kiss with a women on the patio. Thanks Justyn and Jack for the birthday wishes and for my new walker L.O.L

HOLY RED TRUCK!!! WOW...BRAVO ZULU! At work today debating what to do for lunch.....so online i went. The picture alone of their menu, amazing! I said why not.....GLAD I DID!!! The asian bbq wings, SUPER DELICIOUS! Wow...felt like i was overseas again.... in the honk kong asian market at fenwick pier! That tang....sweet...spicey, all in one. THATS NOT ALL! Then...the BBQ Footlong. That very first bite, felt like i was in Wrigley Field at a Live Ball game!  I swear, i dont why this is my first time.....BUT DEFINITELY NOT MY LAST!  You will not regret guys. PLUS, I ordered on Skip and it was in my mouth in about 32 mins. BRAVO ZULU!
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for your 5 stars and awesome review! We appreciate you taking the time to review us and hope to see you again soon!!

detailed_reviews.review_text: That chicken burger is absolutely delicious. I had it on my first visit. Ive been here 5 times now. The chicken burger was so good, I have not even bothered trying anything else. I beg for it each time I return. One issue with this area, is youll occasionally see hypodermic needles lying around outside. Watch your step. Nothing against this restaurant. Its just the area its located in. I still highly advise visiting this restaurant/brewery. Its great.

This brewery has one of the best locations in town. Long tables works perfect for large groups. They have brew tours and a very good selection of beer. The bourbon ale its for me there best beer. They have live music Fridays and Saturdays. The food menu is amazing and the grilled cheese its definitely by itself a reason to visit red truck.
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for the review Alonso! Glad you enjoyed yourself, hope to see you here again soon!

detailed_reviews.review_text: I have been to many breweries in Vancouver and Red Truck is definitely in my top three. Its a large space which means you have more of a chance of finding a space, the decor inside and out is very in keeping with the name of the brewery and the cool old school trucks help with this vibe. There is wheelchair accessible entrance and also a disabled toilet on the main floor. The menu is quite varied but I have to say if you are looking for something healthy you will definitely struggle, even their salads arent amazingly healthy with creamy dressings etc. However, if your looking for a roadside truck stop classic this is the place! The beer is great and they always have tons of variety and seasonal specials, most of the staff are friendly and all of them are knowledgeable about the beer. Go make a pit stop there!
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for the in-depth review Natalie! Were really happy you enjoyed yourself--hope to see you again soon!

detailed_reviews.review_text: This is a great brewery not too far from Central Vancouver. I ordered a flight where I was able to sample four of their beers. The Oktoberfest (seasonal) and the stout were my favorites! It is definitely a must if youre visiting breweries in Vancouver. Also, the food smells incredible!
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for the 5-star review James, we really appreciate the feedback.

detailed_reviews.review_text: One of the better Microbrewery! Great ambiance and the food is delicious  . They also have one of best prices off sales in town. Check out their Growler fill up Happy Hours (see pic) The beer is clean and well balanced. from the offset it looks like a giant American corporation but apparently it s not, it s a bunch of local talented people who knew how to build and run a brand. Everything about the experience feels natural and well thought out... and their concert series should be something to watch out for.
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for your kind review, Viken. We are very much a small, independent craft brewery that started in North Vancouver in 2005 and has since moved to our new location as of August 2014. We look forward to continuing deliver the freshest beer on four wheels and exceeding your expectations in the future.

detailed_reviews.review_text: A laid-back, no-nonsense microbrewery in East Vancouver, Red Truck offers a good selection of highly drinkable beers and tasty bar snacks. The large patio, friendly service, and funky theme decor enhance the overall experience.
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for the review!

detailed_reviews.review_text: Great Brewery with lots of space and seating, tasty food and music! We had some great beers. They have some you can buy and take away if you find something that you like. Great food options! I had a Chicago hot dog and fries which was perfect for having a couple of beers. Very tasty and high quality. They had a great musician playing. It was lively and super fun.
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for the great review Lianne! Were happy to hear you had a good time. Hope well see you back again soon!

detailed_reviews.review_text: While this is not my go to place for beer in Vancouver this place has the best food out of all the beer company/ breweries I have been to in Vancouver. I have been here prepandemic and currently but I keep going back for their food and friendly service. With COVID they have such a clear entry exit setup and all the tables are well distanced. Their fries are so good whether you get the poutine or chili cheese ones or my favourite ones; I DEFINITELY recommend the buffalo fries with blue cheese! Aint nothing hit the spot like one of those!
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for the 5* review Danika.  We take pride in offering high standards and have ensured throughout the pandemic to make it a safe space for our customers and employees.  We look forward to seeing you again!

detailed_reviews.review_text: Was a really good experience, well done for the staff, burgers really good and the fries with garlic are the best, the beer and the facilities another 100 points Well done, we will be back soon
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for the raving review Antonio!  We look forward to seeing you soon for a fresh beer, cheers!

detailed_reviews.review_text: Havent been yet but really enjoy your beers. My new favorite is the baja light. Im stocking up for the summer. Absolutely awesome, super enjoyable
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Mike, glad to hear youre enjoying Baja Light!

detailed_reviews.review_text: Awesome brewery, my favorite  beer of all time is the classic lager it never gets old. Staff are very kind and friendly and it was a super  chill place to visit have a bite to eat. Highly recommend  coming by and checking it out it beats lining up at the BCL anyday.
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: We appreciate your epic review. Cheers.

detailed_reviews.review_text: As someone who is extra weary of covid, I gotta say these guys are taking every possible precaution -- spaced out tables, out door patios, all staff are masked, QR codes for menus, controlled entry, sanitizers at the entrance, constantly disinfecting, etc... This place has always had great food/drinks/service.  Im super happy that theyre staying open and doing it safely.
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Mark.  Thanks for the 5* review!  We have taken every precaution for the diner here, and trained the staff to keep up to the standards we hold.  Keep safe out there and thanks for the continued support!

detailed_reviews.review_text: Great spot to stop in for tasty beers! Make sure to try the Paloma Wheat!
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for your 5-star review Stuart!

detailed_reviews.review_text: Baja light is the closest I have come to  Mexican beer and I love it. Also super happy that it is sold in bottles.  That is, in fact, what motivated me to buy a case in the first place.  Thanks.
Super cool brewery feel.    Great selection for flight testing. Had myself the breakfast sandwich, I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the food.
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for your 5 start review and we re glad we could exceed your expectations. Cheers.

detailed_reviews.review_text: John our tour guy was great with explaining all about the beer red truck produces and where the company started and came about. Thank you for you hospitality and the beer tasting. I had a great time.
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Rena! Thank you for the kind words--we will be sure to pass the message along to John! Hope to see you back again soon :)

detailed_reviews.review_text: One of the best breweries in vancouver! Great place to go with friends and drink a beer! All the beers are great and food is really good! I will go again!
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks Ariel!  We love having you!

detailed_reviews.review_text: Food was fast with lots of classic options. Grilled cheese was particularly good. Beer was good enough. The kids loved the red truck out front (they can even sit in it!)
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: The brewery is a really cool place for kids to visit!  Lots to see and play on.  We love dogs and bikes as well!

detailed_reviews.review_text: Go get a beer here! If you are in Vancouver red truck is the place to go. Everything about them asserts their position as the best craft brewery in Vancouver. Purposeful decor that matches the theme of the business, a great patio to relax on, bike fixing station for if you may have tied one on, good food, and fair prices. The experience in the brewery tonight changed my clearly wrong perception of the brand when I walked past their bottles in the BCL. Great work.
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for these kind words Evan! We really appreciate everything you said in your review--its amazing to hear our customers enjoying our brewery as much as we do. Hope youll be back soon!

detailed_reviews.review_text: I really like the exterior of this place. Inside you can do tastings and fill your growler. Definitely a great place to come with friends!
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for the review Evangeline!

detailed_reviews.review_text: Went there last night and the food was great. The vibe was nice as well and the beers were nice and tasty. I really want to highlight our server. She was so attentive and checked in often to ensure everything was great. Red Truck you have got a gem! Thank you Sasha!
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks so much for taking the time to let us know about your experience this past weekend! We will pass on your comments to Sasha. Hope to see you again soon!

detailed_reviews.review_text: Food was amazing service was super nice and the environment is amazing plays nice music and the place is super tidy
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for the amazing review Addison!

detailed_reviews.review_text: Beer is good, food is good and service is good. Very relaxing place to spend a few hours.

Not a perfect visit to red truck..the first waiter did not understand what i said to him. ..and we ended up waiting to order instead of ordering at the counter as they normally do.  No blame..dude looked a bit beat up.  The other service staff. Seemed in charge,  red braids, into it attitude got us back on the road though.   Burgers wer pretty standard..fresh and tasty. Fries were salted to a perfect charm. The baja lager was served cold and was super enjoyable.  The mac and cheese is a good option from the sides menu.  Theres a certain ingredient that is unique to the dish amd makes a good pair with the beer i had.  Food came quickly after we ordered and was the proper temperature..side sauces i ordered were full and plenty for our portions.  Would take a bro friend (beer flights looked interesting) or a girl that doesnt need a whole lit of doting and likes to eat.  The bathrooms here are a total experience i didnt see the womens naturally but the mens was custums sinks and faucets and all dark stained wood..a+ and with the theme.  5 stars for the redirect with service staff and great food ..fully loaded burger for under 20 is nice... would recommend/go back to try more beer and have the mac and cheese again.  The menu was full of options...but i stuck to basic bacon cheese  burg.  Totally filling and prepared well.
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hey Louie - thanks for taking the time to do a review and send your great comments about your recent visit to the Truck Stop at Red Truck. I will pass on your feedback to the team as they will appreciate the feedback. We hope to see you again soon! Cheers!!

detailed_reviews.review_text: Beer is pretty good, the amber and blackberry bourbon ale are my favorites. They also have a good food menu and serve Nathans hot dogs.
Great assortment of beer and comfort food favorites. Live music weekly and on theme decor. Loved going here and will definitely go back!
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for the great review John!

detailed_reviews.review_text: Was in with a group on Friday and had a wonderful time. Fantastic beers, very accommodating staff and a killer playlist. Thanks for having us!
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for your great review Aidan! Hope to see you again at the Truck Stop Diner

detailed_reviews.review_text: Great place to have food and fresh delicious beers!

Never would have thought but the fries are GREAT here! Grilled cheese (it s actually a melt) was also excellent and filling. Ordered a flight of beer with the helpful guidance of their staff and loved every single one. Their sours are perfectly sour, I had to order a pint. Prices are very reasonable. Music is a little loud but I loved the atmosphere. You definitely can only chat with the person next to and across from you. Fun place!
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for the review! We take great pride in offering amazing diner classics, prepared simply, and done right.

detailed_reviews.review_text: Good food, great beer. Whats not to love?
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for the review!

detailed_reviews.review_text: I have to say, the customer service and quality of beer at this local establishment are both top shelf variety. I mentioned to them about a possible problem in production they might be having, and they corrected the problem, and went the extra mile. Don t buy Bud, buy BC. So many great local breweries, we are spoiled here in the lower mainland. The folks at Red Truck are top notch!
Really good food, flights and fills here!
1st time at Red Truck so I tried a few beers. Very yummy. Great covid-19 protocols also. Thanks so much, Ill be back.
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: We re glad you enjoyed your time and we really appreciate the awesome 5 star review. Can t wait to have you join us again.

detailed_reviews.review_text: Nice place..nice people there...and nice beer

I had the Texas burger and the amber ale. Very tasty meal. The chairs were a touch wobbly, but thats okay. The atmosphere was great and their aesthetic was on point. Also, the washroom is so friggen cute. You should definitely check it out!
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for the great review Vincent! We have passed your feedback about the chairs along to our Manager to make sure any issues are resolved. Hope to see you back soon!

detailed_reviews.review_text: Love the Midnight run dark lager   wish there is a 8 pack

Happy to see Red Truck reopened now. System working well, servers have been positive and we saw them cleaning between customers. Outside raised deck using the 4 corners only with tables for groups of 6 or less. Lower level has 5-6 picnic tables in enclosed area. Tables inside well spaced. Good and beer still good too:)
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for your support and great review.. Cant wait to have you back again. Cheers!

detailed_reviews.review_text: The brisket sandwiches are amazing. This place is a little pricey but its totally worth it if you are feeling like a treat once in awhile. Ive also tried the chicken tacos and bacon cheeseburger. Both were great!
Delicious - the fish sandwich was amazing and I purchased a shirt and they went over and above and got me a single beer togive to my husband of a new one they were brewing
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks Kirsten!

detailed_reviews.review_text: Cool brewery with rotating taps and a nice food menu.
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for the review Jessica, keep an eye out on new brews we will be crafting up this fall.

detailed_reviews.review_text: Marcus the beer rep is amazing. He might need a raise. He took such good care of me at the signature liquor store in Kelowna. Ill make a point of buying your beer more often as a thank you to him.
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for the shout out for Marcus! He works really hard and is an amazing part of the Red Truck Team. I will let him know about your comments... and thanks for supporting Red Truck Beer. Reach out to us anytime with comments or feedback. Enjoy!!

detailed_reviews.review_text: Mitch was a great help. Had Pineapple Hefeweizen, Lime Pepper, Kettle Sour, and the Berry Bourbon Ale, and it was 4 for 4 hits. Top notch stuff. The Red Truck Dog was delicious. Helpful staff, safe place to eat during COVID-19, and a great general vibe. Red Truck was already my fave, but the brewery is even better.
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for taking the time to review us Jonathan!  We have passed our thanks onto Mitch.  We will keep striving for excellence and we look forward to seeing you next time!

detailed_reviews.review_text: Best hotdog of my life. Yummy yum

I am surprised that I never rated this excellent brewery before. I have been enjoying their wonderful staff, great food, and outstanding selection of beers for quite awhile now.  In fact, I have a can of Defender Bourbon Ale in hand right now.  Mmmm...!  I come here from Spruce Grove, near Edmonton, quite often, and visit the store or pub every time. I have found only one store in Spruce Grove that stocks a limited selection of Red Truck.  If I can in any way help you remedy that distressing situation let me know! Thanks for your great product!
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks Pat, we have always appreciated your ongoing support here at Red Truck.  Be sure to drop in soon for another fresh beer!

detailed_reviews.review_text: A great Micro brewery.  Normally food at microbreweries is limited and although limited at Red Truck, you have to give extra points for having Nathans Coney Island hot dogs.  Went to Red Truck on a sunny weekend and sat on the patio in the sun.  It was a great experience.  Not for people seeking line and fine dining, but if youre into Microbreweries this is an excellent choice.  Good beer and service.  Great patio.
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hey Martin, glad you had a great time, and we hope to see you back soon!

detailed_reviews.review_text: Good selection of lagers on tap. Good comfort food too like ballpark hotdogs. Their food menu is meant to reflect a truck stop and the food is upgraded for an urban environment.

Red Truck has a great atmosphere and friendly staff. I enjoy the live music and events held at the brewery. There is an amazing patio for the summer which is enclosed and heated for the winter. One suggestion would be to lower the volume during live shows. Sometimes it can be hard to have a conversation with the person across the table.
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for the review Dylan!

detailed_reviews.review_text: Friendly staff. Cool truck/beer motif. Great food at a decent price. Good beer. I had the Breakfast Hamburger on a long weekend Monday. The burger with fries and a beer was $14 on the weekend brunch menu. The beer was 22oz instead of 16oz because it was Monster truck Monday. I enjoyed the red pilsner. The burger was tasty and large. The fries were hot, crispy and tasty - I salt and pepper them to my taste. This brewery is right off of the Central Greenaway bike route and has a couple of bike racks for locking up. I will definitely consider returning and recommend to others.
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hey Rick, we cant wait to have you back! Were huge bike fans ourself, so the brewery placement may not have been by accident. We also just installed a new bike tuning station. Perfect for those summer rides.

detailed_reviews.review_text: Awesome food and drinks. Unexpectedly large variety of food choice. Beers on tap are cheaper than restaurants.
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Cheers for the amazing 5 star review.

detailed_reviews.review_text: Had an amazing time celebrating a birthday here. The beer and food is great, and the service is incredible. Their staff are always so nice and happy, this is a most see. Also check out the bathrooms, decor is on point the whole way through this place.
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks so much for the awesome review Cheylene! Were happy you chose Red Truck for your birthday celebrations. Hope well see you here next year :)

detailed_reviews.review_text: Red truck has simply the best staff, the best beer and the best food. Im super picky and Ive never been disappointed here. The food is always fresh, hot and tasty. Everything is made fresh, non processed and with complex taste. You wont regret coming to red truck

Like beer? No seriously... Do you like beer? Yes? Then you need to go to Red Truck Beer and enjoy beer and food. Menu is awesome. Beer is awesome. Their merch is awesome. Highly recommend their lager and IPA selection. Also... Definitely upgrade your hot dog to the foot long.
Great service, good focus on pandemic safety. Really good beer. At first the food prices may seem slightly high ($15+) but the chicken burger is one of the best things in the city.

This place was awesome. I attended a private event here, and it was great. Great food. Great BEER! Great staff. The overall atmosphere was cool, great branding. The brewery was awesome, and I really like supporting businesses who offer great product, and are participants in the local market. Cheers to Red Truck!
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: It was a pleasure to host you. Really appreciate the good review--cant wait to have you back again soon!

detailed_reviews.review_text: My favorite brewery by far. I go every two months for the last few years to swap out my keg. Even wearing my mask I was recognized as a regular customer. The service is exceptional and James is the best!!!!!
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks Brent, we appreciate the support over the years, cheers!

detailed_reviews.review_text: Great beer. I would definitely recommend taking the brewery tour. We had a blast going behind the scenes and learning more about the beer. And it ends in a beer tasting with a glass to take home. It s also one of the largest breweries in the city and they have free parking.
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks Tyler! We have brewery tours Fridays 5pm - 6pm or Sat & Sun from 2pm - 5pm.

detailed_reviews.review_text: Tables were spaced out nicely. Our server Daryl was awesome; she has a great sense of humor and a positive attitude. Would come back based on this positive experience.
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for the wonderful review and will be sure to pass along your feedback to Darel.

detailed_reviews.review_text: Amazing food and beer, with friendly staff! Thanks for a great experience
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for your 5-star review Colin!

detailed_reviews.review_text: What an amazing place! The concept is super fun, the saff Shawn & Brendan are amazing and the beers   Be sure to check out the cool bathrooms    I cant wait for summer to enjoy some bevs on their patio.

I wasnt at any place.   I am on Galiano Island and decided to grab some beers from the local store to enjoy in the hot tub.   So many unfamiliar choices on the shelves.   Grabbed some Red Truck Round Trip Amber Ale.   Dang that was some tasty beer.   Perfect with my dinner and perfect in the cliffside hot-tub.  Am a I allowed to curse on here?  G.. Da.. that was good beer!!!!!!!!!!
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for the review John, we are glad you enjoyed the beer, the Amber Ale was the first beer we ever brewed, and what more to top it off than a sweet view and cliffside hot-tub, feel free to send any photos to us for IG/Facebook in future, and well give you a shoutout.

detailed_reviews.review_text: Had the schnitzel and chicken thigh sandwhich. Both were homeruns, juicy dripping with sauce and flavour. Had 2 flights of beer, so we tried the majority. I would 100% return and encourage anyone thinking about trying this place!
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Love it Shawn, hope to see you again soon.

detailed_reviews.review_text: Great deal on beer+footlong hot dog, which was delicious. Nice atmosphere and good beer with the East Van Running Crew on Monday evenings.
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for coming by and sharing your review! We hope to see you again soon. Cheers!

detailed_reviews.review_text: I love this place! I visit this place as a meeting spot with friends where we have a couple of beer and some local pub food. I always find that there are seasonal options as  well as their standard offerings. The staff is friendly and helpful and love the decor. I have also tried the axe throwing event, that was interesting.
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for the kind words Paul!

detailed_reviews.review_text: Killer tap list, perfectly executed truck stop food
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: We love having you as a customer!  Thanks for the review.

detailed_reviews.review_text: Really great live music, super delicious beer and real dece pub food
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for the great review!  Hope to see you again soon.  We have live music every Friday and Saturday night!

detailed_reviews.review_text: Fabulous Brewery. Atmosphere was super lively, and the beer was excellent (especially the blackberry bourbon ale). Also some of the best french fries Ive ever had.
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Glad you enjoyed yourself Damon! Hope to see you back soon.

detailed_reviews.review_text: Love the ambience, the food and the drinks! Theyre currently open and following covid protocols to the T.
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks Ramlah, we do our best to ensure a safe and enjoyable experience here, see you soon at the Truckstop!

detailed_reviews.review_text: amazing service from jack and everyone as always

Boasting one of the finest and largest facilities of any Vancouver brewery, Red Truck is like the Taj Mahal of craft beer. With a great patio, tasty food menu, their Summer Concert Series in the parking lot (complete with great bands, food trucks, great times and lots of beer) and one of the coolest bathroom sinks Ive ever seen, this is a great place for  a beer or three. Within walking distance of many other breweries, so also a must-stop on any brewery walking tour.
Very cool and unique place. Good food, great beer, and awesome aesthetics. Its a little on the pricier side, but would be fun for a chill place to hang out with some buddies.
detailed_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks for the review Tyler! Were glad you enjoyed yourself--hope to see you back here soon

detailed_reviews.review_text: This is a lovely place to have a couple of beers with friends and enjoy the sunny patio in summer. Proximity to the bike route is a plus. The best part is the recent addition of Golden Ale to their beer offer. I only hope its going to become a staple.
Great beer, great experience.
